stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why European governments began to pass laws regulating labor conditions over the course of the nineteenth century?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of the origins and effects of industrialization.

choicesHtml: Governments wanted to return to the guild system of labor.
Governments were increasingly under political pressure to relieve problems caused by industrialization.
Governments were increasingly influenced by laissez-faire economic policies.
Governments wanted to redirect industrial laborers toward conscripted military service.
